tool.name: qiime2 feature-classifier extract-reads

param.name: f_primer
param.label: f_primer: Str
param.validator: value is not None and len(value) > 0

param.name: r_primer
param.label: r_primer: Str
param.help: [required] reverse primer sequence (5' -> 3'). Do not use reverse-complemented primer sequence.
param.validator: value is not None and len(value) > 0

param.name: trim_right
param.label: trim_right: Int
param.help: [default: 0] trim_right nucleotides are removed from the 3' end if trim_right is positive. Applied before trunc_len and trim_left.

param.name: trunc_len
param.label: trunc_len: Int
param.help: [default: 0] read is cut to trunc_len if trunc_len is positive. Applied after trim_right but before trim_left.

param.name: trim_left
param.label: trim_left: Int
param.help: [default: 0] trim_left nucleotides are removed from the 5' end if trim_left is positive. Applied after trim_right and trunc_len.

param.name: identity
param.label: identity: Float
param.help: [default: 0.8] minimum combined primer match identity threshold.

param.name: min_length
param.label: min_length: Int % Range(0, None)
param.help: [default: 50] Minimum amplicon length. Shorter amplicons are discarded. Applied after trimming and truncation, so be aware that trimming may impact sequence retention. Set to zero to disable min length filtering.

param.name: max_length
param.label: max_length: Int % Range(0, None)
param.help: [default: 0] Maximum amplicon length. Longer amplicons are discarded. Applied before trimming and truncation, so plan accordingly. Set to zero (default) to disable max length filtering.

param.name: n_jobs
param.label: n_jobs: Int % Range(1, None)
param.help: [default: 1] Number of seperate processes to run.

param.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__select__
param.label: batch_size: Int % Range(1, None) | Str % Choices('auto')
param.help: [default: 'auto'] Number of sequences to process in a batch. The `auto` option is calculated from the number of sequences and number of jobs specified.

param.name: batch_size
param.label: batch_size: Int % Range(1, None)
param.help: [required] Number of sequences to process in a batch. The `auto` option is calculated from the number of sequences and number of jobs specified.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: feature-classifier extract-reads ========================================= Extract reads from reference sequences.
Outputs: -------- :reads.qza: <no description>
|
Description: ------------ Extract simulated amplicon reads from a reference database. Performs in-silico PCR to extract simulated amplicons from reference sequences that match the input primer sequences (within the mismatch threshold specified by `identity`). Both primer sequences must be in the 5' -> 3' orientation. Sequences that fail to match both primers will be excluded. Reads are extracted, trimmed, and filtered in the following order: 1. reads are extracted in specified orientation; 2. primers are removed; 3. reads longer than `max_length` are removed; 4. reads are trimmed with `trim_right`; 5. reads are truncated to `trunc_len`; 6. reads are trimmed with `trim_left`; 7. reads shorter than `min_length` are removed.
|
